Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: WallyJG
Reviews.Content: Please do not waste your money staying here. For the extra £20 or £30 stay somewhere else. The room was cramped and absolutely filthy. The bed clothes had stains on them, I was bitten by bed bugs. Doors were kept closed using spoons, light fittings falling off ceiling with wires showing. Fluorescent strip lighting was main bedroom light. Toilet was a portaloo type with a shower. Breakfast consisted of sainsburys basics yogurt and you were crammed in like battery hens. Please see my photos, I am NOT exaggerating.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: yellowbertha
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here. It is disgusting. My daughter and I paid £89 for a twin room measuring 13 ft by 7 ft with a plastic pod- like shower/toilet taking up part of the space. There was no light in the shower so if you pulled the folding door across you were in the pitch black. Beds were touching and although sheets were clean the old war time woollen blankets and top cover were stained and dirty. Glass in window was broken and curtains were filthy. Breakfast was in a small basement room (like a hostel), food was awful and guests had to queue until a table became free. I felt ashamed of being British when I saw that nearly all guests were foreign and were staying in such an awful place.

Reviews.Title: “awful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tamwad
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, if people are considering staying there, don't!!! would have been better off in a hostel. It was dirty, cramped, cold. There was no milk for tea coffee facilities. Hairs in sink and bottom of shower cubicle. Hairs and stains on bedding. Tiny toilet with shower and basin all cramped in a space no bigger than a cupboard. No quilt on bed, just blanket and we were freezing. The hot tap kept turning itself on all night keeping us awake. lamp was broke and the curtains were hanging off the rail!!! staff were not really that friendly, especially the two girls serving breakfast, one of them couldn't speak a word of English and the other was downright rude when I asked her to seat us because there were no tables available when we came down for breakfast. She shushed me away with her hand. we ended up going to the British museum to get our breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Sgorla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is suitated near Russell square, in a part of London I particularly love. Despite the trip advices, I decided to book there beacause of the price. Spent there 3 nights. Well I wasted my company money ... At first it was not easy to find the hotel: despite the name on the sign in the street you actually enter the Guildford hotel. The room was a 6 sq meeters burial niche under the roof of the building: it was almost impossible to open the door because of the furnitures ... The bed was a sort of mat whjile sheet and blanket. The bathroom was small. Because of the position and the dimensions the room was particularly hot. I had breakfast in a sort of kithen downstairs where they gaveme some tea and crakers. Nobody could use English ..... Please, do not look at the price and find a different place for your stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - Its the pits”
Reviews.Author: PaulWat9
Reviews.Content: I was shocked. I was annoyed with myself that I didn't pay more to stay somewhere else. I was in the basement, small, dingy, couldn't risk leaving the window open so had to sleep with the heating on. Mould in the shower, water was cold - not very nice to shower. I got them to turn the heating off but was so tempted to travel home last night, but decided to have a few drinks and leave early this morning. They only had one other room available on the 3rd floor, people are obviously not learning or voting with their feet. The Guildford also owns the 'new wing' which is the Glenville as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all good please spend a bit more and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: brakenneeds
Reviews.Content: I did not really look at my room I dropped my bag and went to met friends, but when I got back around 11 at night I sat on the bed for the first time to find the mattress was so worn the dip was huge and very uncomfortable. The shower room was dirty, (dark curly hairs everywhere) and so small that the shower curtain (which was stained in mould) would touch the skin if you did decide to venture in! Obviously I could not sleep and felt dirty lying in the bed, the blanket and sheets had seen better days, eventually at 0600 I went to reception and stated I wanted to check out as I was supposed to be there two nights, the receptionist asked what was wrong and stated that he could offer me a new room. I came back later the same day and was offered a double room, the mattress was 1000% better, no dip and a proper shower room, however I still unsure if the room was clean but I did stay for the second night to my detriment as I woke up with bites all over my arms, I went to see the doctor who stated they looked like bites, can you imagine! A nice weekend in London spoilt by lack of sleep and now I am treating my skin for bites.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly the worst hotel I've EVER stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Starlet001
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner booked into this hotel as it was one of the cheapest we could find last minute. Having known what it would be like, I would have happily paid masses more to stay anywhere else. On arrival, I was slightly concerned by the fact that the two people in front of me at the reception were complaining and one of the doors in the lobby had been propped open using a carton of gone off milk...I wish I'd have turned and walked out there and then. On stepping up to the reception, the sour-faced member of staff slammed a check in card in front of me without even saying 'hello'. She snatched my credit card off me, took my payment and shoved a key in my hands. On entering the room I was appalled by how grimey it was. It clearly hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The carpets were full of dirt (I'm asthmatic and I left the place with a wheeze due to the dust levels), the glasses and mugs covered in hairs and other peoples toothpaste, spiders on the ceiling, but nothing prepared me for the bathroom... It was covered in congealed dirt, pubic hairs and mould. The shower curtain was so mouldy (and had been tied up with a dirty old plastic bag) that I wouldnt let it even touch me. As the bathroom was so small (the toilet was practically in the shower), you had to step out into the bedroom to dry off - unfortunately this faced a window with no proper curtains that backed onto another persons window which is fine if you're a nudist, if not it wasn't ideal. When we checked in, there had been no mention of breakfast (despite us paying for it) and in the lobby the next morning there was no sign of any activity, Needless to say anyway, we decided that there would be no way we'd eat in such a dump for fear of getting ill, so we headed to the local cafe and paid for breakfast. When we checked out, the woman on reception merely barked at me that 'check out is 11am!!!', to which I replied that I wanted to leave now. She then snatched the keys off me and carried on with her work. Having been all around the world and having stayed in some very very cheap and some pricey accomodation, I have to say that this was without a doubt the WORST hotel experience ever and the WORST value for money. This place should be closed down and if environmental health review it, I guarantee that they will shut it immediately. If you have any sense, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine as a base as long as you'll be out a lot”
Reviews.Author: Fatyak
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be in a great location, only 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross and near to Bloomsbury, which has some nice pubs. The room itself was small and shabby, but clean. The en suite was a horific plastic pod from the 70s but everything worked in it, except for the taps which dripped loudly all night, as you couldn't switch them off. Good value for money considering it's central location, but the staff were not helpful and gave us no indication of where to go for breakfast, so we just went for a fry up on Grey's Inn Road. If all you are looking for is a base then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: nursewend
Reviews.Content: I would not call this place a hotel and I think a hostel would have been nicer! The place was dirty, the toilet leaked, the en suite ( if thats what it was) was like the sort of thing you get in a caravan. The bed and pillows were very uncomfortable and it was very noisy until the early hours of the morning. I came home with at least 12 botes all over me and I know I got them from this hotel! I don't feel I can do anything about this as I have no proof that the hotel was where I got them from. The breakfast was appalling and I would not stay here again if they paid me!

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!!”
Reviews.Author: SallyΦl
Reviews.Content: Tired,dirty and rooms like cells - rooms in basement were gross offered alternatives but no better really. En suite was tiny - hair and blood on the toilet and wash basin. Please don't waste your money - reported findings but staff not concerned - responded with a shrug.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: SwissNoodle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grenville House hotel for one night while travelling through London. As soon as I saw the room my first impulse was to turn around and go find another place to stay, but since I arrived quite late at night that wasn't an option. I really have nothing good to say about the hotel. Here are the facts: - It smells like mildew. You too will smell like a walking fungus by the time you leave. - The room (or should I say broom closet? It doesn't really deserve to be called a room) was in the basement--tiny, dark, damp and right by the noisy street. - I heard every single mouse fart in the neighbourhood. People on the street, snoring somewhere in the hotel, someone going to the bathroom--and it all sounded like it was happening right next to my bed. - Wind and damp came in through the window. There was no heating, so I spent the night wearing tights, socks, a cardigan and a jacket along with my PJs to stave off the cold. - Dirty sheets and towels. I periodically woke up itching all over and--lo and behold--discovered bites on my legs the next day. - The integrated shower/toilet cubicle appears to have once belonged to a caravan. And no prizes for guessing that it was dirty. I can't comment on the breakfast. I got up very early and fled, without bothering to find out how many cockroaches or mouse droppings they served up alongside the sliced bread and processed cheese. If there is a hell it surely is modelled on the Grenville House. Would not wish this on my worst enemy. Stay well away!

Reviews.Title: “A filthy ,obnoxious and despicable place !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dryada
Reviews.Content: Greniville Hotel is the worst hotel I have ever seen. The rooms are extremely small ,dirty and the very very overpriced in comparison to what the hotel has to offer. The rooms were never cleaned,the sheets and towels were dirty (I suspect that they hadnt changed them for over a month).There was dust everywhere and the bathroom was barely for one person. The so called breakfast was not worth waking up for. I complained twice in the reception about not cleaning the room and nothing changed. They called us twice at 7:30 in the morning asking us to pay them despite that our check out date was 3 days later. The only positive thing was the location (close to Russel square ) but this was not enough to cover the price for this filthy place. Spare yourselves 10-20 more pounds per person and avoid staying in this rathole.

Reviews.Title: “A Shocking Hole - Wouldn't let my Dog Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: WengerBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Room was absolutely filthy - floor clearly not hoovered, bed linen dirty and bathroom was the worst I have ever seen!! There was no soap, shampoo or toilet paper, I had to go to the 24 hour store down the road to buy these things because I checked in at 11pm. There was grime and dirt all over the bathroom, when I got into the shower and pulled back the shower door........to my horror, there was a long, big, thick black strand of hair from the previous occupant stuck to the door, I nearly wretched. The room was freezing cold, the radiators didnt work and I actually got under the covers fully clothed and slept like that. The room was so poorly cleaned I even put my bag on one of the other beds because I didn't want to get anything contaminated. I didnt read the reviews before going to this hotel, however I have just seen the pictures of the bedrooms and I can promise you they are NOTHING like that in the hotel. The only reason I didnt check out there and then was because I had nowhere else to go, the Comfort Inn, Premier Inn & Travel Lodge in Kings Cross were all fully booked. STAY AWAY from this Hole - You have all been warned!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: RJLBaltimore
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt a budget hotel. I booked it because it was one of the cheapest I could find in a central London location. The room (a double) was freezing--the heat was turned off during certain hours, I was told, because most of the guests are not there during the day. However, it never seemed to get warm, even at night when you'd expect the heat to be turned on. The hot water seemed to be on a timer as well--one day it was warm, the next it was lukewarm at best. When I told the reception about it, the response I received was "that's impossible." The toilet leaked after flushing it, the bathroom had a very unpleasant smell emanating from it, and the television remote control was broken. I can accept these problems to some extent if I'm expecting budget accommodation, but at Â£70 ($140 for me as an American) a night, that's not a budget price. Breakfast, which was provided by individuals that were difficult to communicate with, was very basic and entirely rushed. The only positive thing is the location, which was still a bit of a walk from the nearest tube stop. I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all unless their prices were lowered significantly.

HotelInfo.Name: Grenville House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Guilford Street | Bloomsbury, London WC1N 1DR, England
